transcript:
day, which was yesterday, those gen- tlemen, messieurs les marechaux 
Murat, Lan- nes, and Belliard, mount and ride to the bridge. (Observe that all three are Gascons.) 'Gentle- men,' says one of them, 'you know the Thabor Bridge is mined and doubly mined and that there are menacing fortifications at its head and an army of fifteen thousand men has been or- dered to blow up the bridge and not let us cross? But it will please our sovereign the Em- peror Napoleon if we take this bridge, so let us
